body: I am encountering this issue as well. The error seems like the CoreFoundation framework is not being linked in somehow?
I was able to work around the issue with `bundle config build.grpc --with-ldflags="-Wl,-undefined,dynamic_lookup"`.

See this issue as well; moved past it with similar steps to @tdyas. Running with:
```
grpc: 1.56.0
ruby 3.2.2
macOs 12.6.6 (21G646)
Apple M1 Pro
```

> I was able to work around the issue with `bundle config build.grpc --with-ldflags="-Wl,-undefined,dynamic_lookup"`.

Solved my issue as well, thank you very much @tdyas

Add -weak_framework CoreFoundation to the ruby extension link line on arm64-darwin, to address "undefined symbols" issues from #33483

Closes #33483

Supersedes #33513

cc @apolcyn

issue.title: gem install grpc --> Undefined symbols for architecture arm64:

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
<!--
PLEASE DO NOT POST A QUESTION HERE.
This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

For general questions and troubleshooting, please ask/look for answers at StackOverflow, with "grpc" tag: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/grpc

For questions that specifically need to be answered by gRPC team members, please ask/look for answers at grpc.io mailing list: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/grpc-io

Issues specific to *grpc-java*, *grpc-go*, *grpc-node*, *grpc-dart*, *grpc-web* should be created in the repository they belong to (e.g. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-LANGUAGE/issues/new)
-->

### What version of gRPC and what language are you using?

Trying to install grpc 1.56.0 from my ruby gemfile. I currently have 1.52.0

### What operating system (Linux, Windows,...) and version?
Apple M1 Max, Mac osx Ventura 13.4.1 (22F82)

### What runtime / compiler are you using (e.g. python version or version of gcc)

### What did you do?
Please provide either 1) A unit test for reproducing the bug or 2) Specific steps for us to follow to reproduce the bug. If theres not enough information to debug the problem, gRPC team may close the issue at their discretion. Youre welcome to re-open the issue once you have a reproduction.

`bundle update grpc`

which results in 

```bash
An error occurred while installing grpc (1.56.0), and Bundler cannot continue.

In Gemfile:
  google-cloud-translate was resolved to 3.3.0, which depends on
    google-cloud-translate-v3 was resolved to 0.3.0, which depends on
      gapic-common was resolved to 0.3.4, which depends on
        googleapis-common-protos was resolved to 1.4.0, which depends on
          grpc
```

Then I try:

`gem install grpc`

```bash
40 warnings generated.
compiling rb_enable_cpp.cc
linking shared-object grpc/grpc_c.bundle
Undefined symbols for architecture arm64:
  "_CFRelease", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
  "_CFStringGetCString", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
  "_CFStringGetLength", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
  "_CFStringGetMaximumSizeForEncoding", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
  "_CFTimeZoneCopyDefault", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
  "_CFTimeZoneGetName", referenced from:
      absl::lts_20230125::time_internal::cctz::local_time_zone() in libgrpc.a(time_zone_lookup.o)
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture arm64
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make: *** [grpc_c.bundle] Error 1

make failed, exit code 2
```

### What did you expect to see?
I expected the gem to install

### What did you see instead?
See output above

Make sure you include information that can help us debug (full error message, exception listing, stack trace, logs).

See [TROUBLESHOOTING.md](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/TROUBLESHOOTING.md) for how to diagnose problems better.

### Anything else we should know about your project / environment?

body: This problem may not be limited to `arm64-darwin`. I had another person on my team run into this on `x86-darwin`, though using the precompiled gem is a workaround for now.

issue.title: [ruby] Fix linking errors on x86-darwin

labels.name: release notes: yes
labels.description: Indicates if PR needs to be in release notes

labels.name: imported
labels.description: Specifies if the PR has been imported to the internal repository

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/33538 added `-weak_framework CoreFoundation` in `DLDFLAGS` for only `arm64-darwin` builds, but the issue reported in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/33483 can also happen on `x86-darwin` builds. This can happen if:

1. The Ruby interpreter is compiled without `-Wl,-undefined,dynamic_lookup`.
2. This happens if the Ruby interpreter is built with XCode 14.0 to 14.2 (https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/19005).

Simplify the logic and always include `-weak_framework CoreFoundation` for macOS builds.
